p.s: In the beginning of the scene Starr is traumatised because she got back to the place where Khalil was shot for the first time.
She is emotionally overwhelmed by her feelings and memories until the voices of the protesting crowd bring her back.
Starr is using this trauma to chant along with the crowd.
At first she is quiet but remembers Khalil and gets louder.
Then she remembers him opening the door to look if she is ok and then getting shot that memoriememory gives her the final push and she screams along with the crowd (ll. 18-23).

During the whole scene Starr is narrating in a language she can also use at Williamson Prep until she is standing on the police car and the officer orders them to leave and Starr thinks fuck it (l. 58).
After that she is using slang even in her thoughts.
This represents her inner exceptensacceptance of her importansimportance in that curse and also the importansimportance of her voice as a weapon.
At this moment she also starts using her voice confidently.
In the scene Starr at first wants to fight the system but Ms. Ofrah convinces her to use her voice for this.
Starr realises that she was right and that her voice is powerfullpowerful.

Starr is using a comparison between trigger happy and speaker happy which means that one-fifteen had the power to kill Khalil by pulling his trigger and Starr has the power to make the world a better place for black people.
